Package io.github.ai4ci.config.setup

Interface SetupConfiguration

All Superinterfaces:
Abstraction.Named, Abstraction.Replica, Serializable
@Immutable public interface SetupConfiguration extends Abstraction.Named, Abstraction.Replica, Serializable
Configuration used during model setup and initialisation.

Main purpose: encapsulate the parameters and strategies required to create agents and construct their contact network at the start of a simulation. Features include:

  • the number of initial imports used to seed an outbreak;
  • a pluggable network generation strategy via NetworkConfiguration;
  • a pluggable demographic strategy via DemographicConfiguration;
  • utility methods for spatial placement such as hilbertBits() and getHilbertCoords(Integer).

Downstream uses: instances are consulted by model builders and initialisers during setup. Typical consumers include DefaultPersonInitialiser and AbstractModelBuilder. Implementations are commonly generated by Immutables (see ImmutableSetupConfiguration).

Author:
Rob Challen

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT

      static final io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.ImmutableSetupConfiguration DEFAULT
      Default setup configuration used in examples and tests.

  • Method Details

    • getDemographics

      DemographicConfiguration getDemographics()
      Demographic configuration.

      This selects the demographic strategy used when creating persons and when computing pairwise relationship strengths. Common implementations include:

      • UnstratifiedDemography — draws strengths from a single distribution;
      • AgeStratifiedDemography — samples ages and adjusts contact odds by age difference;
      • LocationAwareDemography — supplies spatial placement and proximity based modifiers.

      Demographic implementations are responsible for providing DemographicConfiguration.createPersonStub(io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak) used during setup and DemographicConfiguration.getRelationshipStrength(io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) used when composing contact probabilities. If you need richer per‑person data (for example loading census CSVs) provide a custom Demographic implementation and register it via Jackson polymorphism.

      Returns:
      the demographic configuration used during person creation and baselining

    • getHilbertCoords

      default double[] getHilbertCoords(Integer id)
      For sequentially created networks such as Watts‑Strogatz the geographical location can be decided by the ring position. This will tend to create a network that has geographical location correlating to network topology.

      The returned coordinates are normalised to the unit square [0,1]x[0,1] and are suitable for assigning locationX/locationY on PersonDemographic during setup. The method uses a Hilbert curve with bits chosen to provide adequate resolution for the configured network size.

      Parameters:
      id - the ring position (for example the sequential node index)
      Returns:
      an X‑Y geographical location (range 0 to 1)

    • getInitialImports

      Integer getInitialImports()
      Number of initial cases to seed the outbreak with.

      Used by DefaultPersonInitialiser to compute a simple per‑person importation probability during initialisation. The value represents a coarse seeding strategy; for more sophisticated seeding (geographically localised or stratified by demographic) supply a custom initialiser in a composed AbstractModelBuilder.

      Returns:
      the number of initial imports to seed

    • getNetwork

      NetworkConfiguration getNetwork()
      Network generation configuration.

      The returned NetworkConfiguration defines which graph model is used to construct the social network during the setup stage. The project provides a few common implementations:

      • ErdosReyniConfiguration — classical G(n,p) random graph;
      • WattsStrogatzConfiguration — small‑world rewired lattice;
      • BarabasiAlbertConfiguration — preferential attachment / scale free.

      Builders call NetworkConfiguration.generateGraph(org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleGraph<io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultEdge>) passing an empty JGraphT SimpleGraph<Person,DefaultEdge> to populate nodes and edges. To add a new topology implement a new configuration type and register it with the Jackson polymorphic mapping used by the config loader.

      Returns:
      the network configuration used for agent placement and contact construction

    • hilbertBits

      default org.davidmoten.hilbert.SmallHilbertCurve hilbertBits()
      Utility method to compute a Hilbert curve with bits chosen to provide adequate resolution for the configured network size. This is used by getHilbertCoords(Integer) to compute spatial coordinates for agents based on their ring position. The returned curve is 2‑dimensional and has bits chosen such that the total number of points on the curve is at least the network size, ensuring a unique coordinate for each agent.
      Returns:
      a SmallHilbertCurve instance with bits set for the configured network size
